Additionally, you can set a specific tim: Additionally, you can set a specific time interval at which the counter will be updated.
Adds lists and a widget that counts serv: Adds lists and a widget that counts service messages like unreachable devices or devices with empty battery, firmware-updates and so on
Adds lists and a widget that monitors th: Adds lists and a widget that monitors the ioBroker-Adapters and lists Adapter-Errors
Adds lists with corresponding widgets to: Adds lists with corresponding widgets to display (opened) windows. You may need to adjust the list a little bit, if too much states are found. Best way to do is to create a ioBroker-Enumeration with all your windows and add the enumeration (with childs) to the list instead of all states. Have a look at the wiki on github, there are some examples how to do that.

Also used to display and configure widge: Also used to display and configure widgets

Automatically open panel on large screen: Automatically open panel on large screens

By activating 'Just Prefix' just the pre: By activating 'Just Prefix' just the prefix is placed (not the value nor the postfix), if the condition matches.
By adding a debounce-time, you can preve: By adding a debounce-time, you can prevent it from updating to often (for example if some values change nearly simultanously).
Calculations can be used to combine nume: Calculations can be used to combine numeric states and calculate for example the sum of different counters.

Combinations can be used to combine diff: Combinations can be used to combine different states with text.
Compare operators work case insensitive. You can also compare with multiple values at one time if you provide comma-separated list of arguments (for example: |remove|ID|doesn't end with|.error,.overheat| will remove all IDs that don't end with .error OR .overheat).

Technically, widgets are web pages that: Technically, widgets are web pages that are included as the background of a tile. The settings of the widget can therefore be changed later in the device settings under BACKGROUND_URL.
That means, if you change settings of th: That means, if you change settings of the source device, the destination device will also change

The buttons with the iQontrol logo open: The buttons with the iQontrol logo open or update a preview window that can be used to check the current settings.
The colorspace has to be defined in the: The colorspace has to be defined in the devicespecific options below
The conditions are processed from top to: The conditions are processed from top to bottom.
The counters update everytime a datapoin: The counters update everytime a state in your TOTAL_LIST is changed.

You can also combine objects like arrays: You can also combine objects like arrays (lists) by addition or subtraction.
You can also specify a 'Else' text, that: You can also specify a 'Else' text, that will be placed, if the condition doesn't match.
You can also try to use the Autocreate-F: You can also try to use the Autocreate-Function to choose an existing device from the iobroker-object-tree. Autocreate tries to find out the role and to match as many states as possible.
You can also try to use the Autocreate-Function to chose an existing device from the iobroker-object-tree. Autocreate tries to find out the role and to match as many states as possible.
You can also use URL-Parameters to deter: You can also use URL-Parameters to determine, which view or even dialog will be loaded at start
You can consider views as something like: You can consider views as something like a page.
You can consider views as something like a pages.
You can create backups under Options - B: You can create backups under Options - Backup/Restore.
You can create this device now if you wa: You can create this device now if you want.
You can define several counters that cou: You can define several counters that count for given conditions in your TOTAL_LIST.
You can leave the id empty, then the ori: You can leave the id empty, then the original id will be used.
You can upload your own icons to the fol: You can upload your own icons to the folder '/usericons'
You can use variables in device-names an: You can use variables in device-names and image-filenames
You can use variables in device-names, b: You can use variables in device-names, button-captions and headings
You can use variables in headings, devic: You can use variables in headings, device-names and image-filenames
You can use variables in image-filenames: You can use variables in image-filenames
You can use your images as background-im: You can use your images as background-images for views, or for devices.
You have to assign a name to every count: You have to assign a name to every counter. If you leave the name-field empty in the subsequent lines, all conditions belong to the counter above and all have to be fulfilled.
You have to assign unique names to the c: You have to assign unique names to the columns.
You have unsaved changes. Close anyway?: You have unsaved changes. Close anyway?
You need to activate integrated socket.I: You need to activate integrated socket.IO and disable 'Force Web-Sockets' in web-adapter-settings!
Your admin-adapter runs in http-mode, bu: Your admin-adapter runs in http-mode, but web-adapter in https. Therefore socket.io could not be loaded because mixed content is blocked. To get this working, enable https-mode in admin or disable https-mode in one instance of web-adapter.
Your admin-adapter runs in https-mode, b: Your admin-adapter runs in https-mode, but web-adapter in http. Therefore socket.io could not be loaded because mixed content is blocked. To get this working, enable https-mode in one instance of web-adapter.
edit description: In edit mode you can add, delete or modify the extensions. Additionally the elements can be sorted or styled.
if checked, the control will be displaye: if checked, the control will be displayed with half width.
